comments:
From reading the newsgroups, it appears that it is possible to use the CygWin 
GDB to debug arm-elf and mips using Eclipse CDT  org.eclipse.cdt-200304220246-
win32_1.0.1.zip

I've compiled an ARM program using GCC 3.3 CygWin ARM cross compiler.

The text debugger works fine, but I when I try to launch it using Eclipse, it 
hangs and I get exceptions in the log.

Here is what I did:

- Compiled arm executable
- Debugged it using arm-elf-gdb in text mode ( copy of session below), to 
verify that everything is OK. All commands in the debug session complete 
instantanously(i.e. <1 sec), so there should be no timeout issues.
- Added "arm" to cpu attribute 
in ./eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.cdt.debug.mi.core_1.0.1/plugin.xml
- Created the following gdbsim.ini file
target sim
load
- Chose "CygWin GDB debugger"
- Set arm-elf-gdb as the debugger
- Set gdbsim.ini as GDB command file
- Breakpoint in main
- Started debug
- After ~10seconds I get an error message:

"Unable to set temporary breakpoint in main"
"Reason: Target request failed: Target is not responding (timed out)"
"Continue?"




C:\e21\workspace\test>arm-elf-gdb hello

Created an attachment (id=4725)
The hello world app project reffered to in the bug report

I was going to attach this as an attachment, but unfortunally there is a 1MB 
limit, download http://www.harboe.org/oyvind/armgdb.zip

Below is a session to reproduce an arm-elf-gdb text debug session.

I'm not sure, but I believe that this is all that is required to test arm-elf-
gdb simulated debug sessions from within Eclipse.

On the offchance that a snapshot of arm-elf-gcc3.3 is useful, I've zipped up 
the installation directory and put it here. I didn't put any effort into 
reducing the size, so its 300MB. Start download at the end of your day :-)


http://www.harboe.org/oyvind/arm-elf-gcc33.zip

Same result with this version of GDB(compiled it for CygWin).

This GDB was configured as "--host=i686-pc-cygwin --target=arm-elf".

The configuration in question is a bare metal ARM target, so there are no 
threads.

GDB crashes when I try to get some info on threads.

(gdb) info threads
   1477 [main] arm-elf-gdb 2656 handle_exceptions: Exception: STATUS_ACCESS_VIOL
ATION
   2663 [main] arm-elf-gdb 2656 open_stackdumpfile: Dumping stack trace to arm-e
lf-gdb.exe.stackdump

I see no signs that arm-elf-gdb pagefaulted, so perhaps this information is 
irrelevant, but I thought I'd include it anyway.


A bit more clarification on the threads problem.

arm-elf-gdb crashes if "info threads" is issued at the wrong time, i.e. before 
the app has been started. Afterwards it returns an empty list as is expected 
for this target.

I found a magic sequence which works around the bug(?) in GDB that it 
crashes/hangs upon "info threads".

I added startup.ini as follows:

#info threads will crash
target sim
load
break main
run
#info threads will crash, but no more!

Created an attachment (id=4753)
Some debug output that shows where gdb crashed
Has this problem been fixed in gdb?

simulation stuff anymore.
